20101229020038.000|20101229020038.000|CC1|RACHEL.

20101229020042.000|20101229020042.000|CC1|SHOW.                           
20101229020042.000|20101229020045.000|CC1|IS IT JUST A PROP?"

20101229020047.000|20101229020048.000|CC1|I KEEP THE HIGHLIGHTER HERE     
20101229020048.000|20101229020050.000|CC1|BECAUSE IF YOU PUT TWO

20101229020137.000|20101229020139.000|CC1|PRODUCERS PRODUCED.             
20101229020139.000|20101229020140.000|CC1|IF THIS SHOW COULD BE KNOWN FOR 
20101229020140.000|20101229020141.000|CC1|ANYTHING, I THINK I WOULD HAVE  
20101229020141.000|20101229020142.000|CC1|US BE KNOWN FOR THAT, FOR       
20101229020142.000|20101229020144.000|CC1|CLEARING STUFF UP.              
20101229020144.000|20101229020148.000|CC1|AND I THINK WE MAY, IN FACT,    
20101229020148.000|20101229020149.000|CC1|BECOMING KNOWN FOR THAT SOME    
20101229020149.000|20101229020150.000|CC1|DAYS BECAUSE OF RESEARCH LIKE

20101229020159.000|20101229020200.000|CC1|TODAY IN ALASKA CRUDE OIL       
20101229020200.000|20101229020202.000|CC1|PRODUCTION WAS ALL BUT STOPPED  
20101229020202.000|20101229020204.000|CC1|ON THE NORTH SLOPE.             
20101229020204.000|20101229020205.000|CC1|OIL COMPANIES OPERATING THERE   
20101229020205.000|20101229020206.000|CC1|WERE TOLD TO CUT THEIR          
20101229020206.000|20101229020207.000|CC1|PRODUCTION BY MORE THAN 80%     
20101229020207.000|20101229020209.000|CC1|AFTER THOUSANDS OF BARRELS OF   
20101229020209.000|20101229020211.000|CC1|CRUDE OIL SPILLED FROM THE      
20101229020211.000|20101229020212.000|CC1|TRANSALASKA OIL PIPELINE.       
20101229020212.000|20101229020216.000|CC1|THE 800-MILE TRANS-ALASKA OIL   
20101229020216.000|20101229020217.000|CC1|PIPELINE AT LEAST FOR RIGHT NOW 
20101229020217.000|20101229020218.000|CC1|IS SHUT DOWN.                   
20101229020218.000|20101229020219.000|CC1|THAT SPILL IN ALASKA IS         
20101229020219.000|20101229020220.000|CC1|HAPPENING, OF COURSE, IN THE    
20101229020220.000|20101229020223.000|CC1|SHADOW OF A MUCH LARGER SPILL IN
20101229020223.000|20101229020224.000|CC1|THE GULF OF MEXICO.             
20101229020224.000|20101229020226.000|CC1|AND ACTUALLY, YOU KNOW WHAT, IF 
20101229020226.000|20101229020228.000|CC1|IT'S OKAY WITH YOU GUYS IN THE  
20101229020228.000|20101229020229.000|CC1|CONTROL ROOM, I THINK WE SHOULD 
20101229020229.000|20101229020230.000|CC1|PROBABLY JUST HAVE ME STOP DOING
20101229020230.000|20101229020233.000|CC1|THIS NOW AND LET THE GRAVITAS   
20101229020233.000|20101229020234.000|CC1|WHITE GUY ANCHOR DO THIS PART.  
20101229020234.000|20101229020236.000|CC1|LET'S DO THAT.                  
20101229020236.000|20101229020238.000|CC1|>> IN ALASKA, THE PIPELINE HAS  
20101229020238.000|20101229020239.000|CC1|BEEN REPAIRED.                  
20101229020239.000|20101229020241.000|CC1|OIL IS EXPECTED TO FLOW AGAIN   
20101229020241.000|20101229020241.000|CC1|TODAY.                          
20101229020241.000|20101229020243.000|CC1|BUT THAT CRACK THAT DEVELOPED   
20101229020243.000|20101229020244.000|CC1|SUNDAY ALLOWED 1,500 BARRELS OF 
20101229020244.000|20101229020246.000|CC1|CRUDE OIL TO ESCAPE.            
20101229020246.000|20101229020249.000|CC1|700 BARRELS WERE RECOVERED.     
20101229020249.000|20101229020251.000|CC1|AND IN THE GULF OF MEXICO, OIL  
20101229020251.000|20101229020252.000|CC1|WORKERS ARE TRYING TO HANDLE A  
20101229020252.000|20101229020253.000|CC1|MUCH LARGER OIL SPILL.          
20101229020253.000|20101229020256.000|CC1|A BURNING OFFSHORE OIL WELL IS  
20101229020256.000|20101229020258.000|CC1|DUMPING 30,000 BARRELS OF CRUDE 
20101229020258.000|20101229020259.000|CC1|EACH DAY IN INTO THE GULF.      
20101229020259.000|20101229020301.000|CC1|>> SO, YEAH, THAT WAS FROM 1979,
20101229020301.000|20101229020304.000|CC1|JUNE 13th, 1979.                
20101229020304.000|20101229020305.000|CC1|THAT NBC NEWS ANCHOR REPORTING  
20101229020305.000|20101229020307.000|CC1|ON A PIPELINE SPILL IN ALASKA ON
20101229020307.000|20101229020309.000|CC1|THE SAME DAY THAT AN OIL WELL   
20101229020309.000|20101229020310.000|CC1|WAS LEAKING OUT OF CONTROL AND  
20101229020310.000|20101229020313.000|CC1|BURNING IN THE GULF OF MEXICO.  
20101229020313.000|20101229020315.000|CC1|31 YEARS AGO, IN JUNE 1979, AN  
20101229020315.000|20101229020318.000|CC1|OIL WELL CALLED THE IXTOC BLEW  
20101229020318.000|20101229020319.000|CC1|OUT IN THE GULF OF MEXICO.      
20101229020319.000|20101229020322.000|CC1|IT STARTED SPEWING THOUSANDS OF 
20101229020322.000|20101229020322.000|CC1|BARRELS OF CRUDE OIL INTO THE   
20101229020322.000|20101229020323.000|CC1|GULF EVERY DAY.                 
20101229020323.000|20101229020325.000|CC1|AND IT'S NOT JUST THE DISASTER  
20101229020325.000|20101229020326.000|CC1|ITSELF THAT SHOULD SOUND        
20101229020326.000|20101229020327.000|CC1|FAMILIAR TO YOU.                
20101229020327.000|20101229020329.000|CC1|IT'S ALSO THE TECHNIQUES THAT   
20101229020329.000|20101229020330.000|CC1|THEY WERE USING AT THE TIME TO  
20101229020330.000|20101229020335.000|CC1|TRY TO CONTAIN THE SPILL.       
20101229020335.000|20101229020336.000|CC1|>> AIRPLANES ARE TO BE USED TO  
20101229020336.000|20101229020338.000|CC1|DROP CHEMICALS ON THE OIL, BUT  
20101229020338.000|20101229020339.000|CC1|THERE IS A SHORTAGE OF AVIATION 
20101229020339.000|20101229020341.000|CC1|FUEL DOWN THERE.                
20101229020341.000|20101229020343.000|CC1|THE WORKERS ARE ALSO PUTTING UP 
20101229020343.000|20101229020344.000|CC1|A MILE-LONG BOOM.               
20101229020344.000|20101229020345.000|CC1|THEY'RE PUTTING IT INTO PLACE.  
20101229020345.000|20101229020346.000|CC1|THEY'RE TRYING TO CONTAIN THE   
20101229020346.000|20101229020348.000|CC1|OIL SLICK IN THE GULF OF MEXICO.
20101229020348.000|20101229020351.000|CC1|>> CHEMICAL DISPERSANTS BEING   
20101229020351.000|20101229020353.000|CC1|SPREAD ACROSS THE GULF BY PLANE,
20101229020353.000|20101229020354.000|CC1|MILE-LONG BOOMS BEING SET UP TO 
20101229020354.000|20101229020355.000|CC1|CONTAIN THE OIL SLICK ON THE    
20101229020355.000|20101229020356.000|CC1|SURFACE.                        
20101229020356.000|20101229020357.000|CC1|IF YOU CLOSE YOUR EYES AND YOU  
20101229020357.000|20101229020359.000|CC1|JUST LISTEN TO THESE NEWS       
20101229020359.000|20101229020401.000|CC1|REPORTS FROM 1979 YOU WOULD BE  
20101229020401.000|20101229020403.000|CC1|FORGIVEN FOR THINKING THAT YOU  
20101229020403.000|20101229020404.000|CC1|HAD FLIPPED ON THE NEWS TODAY.  
20101229020404.000|20101229020406.000|CC1|THE IXTOC RIG ERUPTED IN THE    
20101229020406.000|20101229020408.000|CC1|MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT IN 1979 IN  
20101229020408.000|20101229020409.000|CC1|JUNE AS IT WAS DRILLING FOR OIL 
20101229020409.000|20101229020410.000|CC1|IN THE GULF OF MEXICO.          
20101229020410.000|20101229020413.000|CC1|THE DRILLING WAS BEING DONE BY A
20101229020413.000|20101229020416.000|CC1|COMPANY CALLED SED COE.         
20101229020416.000|20101229020418.000|CC1|SEDCOLLATOR BECAME KNOWN AS     
20101229020418.000|20101229020418.000|CC1|TRANSOCEAN.                     
20101229020418.000|20101229020419.000|CC1|THE OPERATOR OF THE RIG THAT    
20101229020419.000|20101229020421.000|CC1|BLEW UP THIS YEAR IN THE GULF OF
20101229020421.000|20101229020421.000|CC1|MEXICO.                         
20101229020421.000|20101229020423.000|CC1|THE REASON THE IXTOC EXPLOSION  
20101229020423.000|20101229020424.000|CC1|TURNED INTO A MASSIVE           
20101229020424.000|20101229020425.000|CC1|UNCONTROLLED LEAK 30 YEARS AGO  
20101229020425.000|20101229020427.000|CC1|WAS BECAUSE THE WELL'S BLOWOUT  
20101229020427.000|20101229020430.000|CC1|PREVENTER MALFUNCTIONED.        
20101229020430.000|20101229020430.000|CC1|SOUND FAMILIAR?                 
20101229020430.000|20101229020433.000|CC1|THE BLOWOUT PREVENTER FAILED TO 
20101229020433.000|20101229020434.000|CC1|STOP THE IXTOC LEAK, AND WHAT   
20101229020434.000|20101229020436.000|CC1|FOLLOWED WAS AN ENVIRONMENTAL   
20101229020436.000|20101229020437.000|CC1|DISASTER THE LIKES OF WHICH THE 
20101229020437.000|20101229020439.000|CC1|COUNTRY HAD NEVER SEEN BEFORE.  
20101229020439.000|20101229020441.000|CC1|>> FLOATING BARRIERS ARE STILL  
20101229020441.000|20101229020442.000|CC1|BEING STRETCHED ACROSS THE      
20101229020442.000|20101229020445.000|CC1|WATERWAY NEAR SOUTH PADRE ISLAND
20101229020445.000|20101229020446.000|CC1|TO KEEP APPROACHING OIL FROM    
20101229020446.000|20101229020447.000|CC1|SPOILING THIS POPULAR SPORT     
20101229020447.000|20101229020449.000|CC1|FISHING AREA, WHICH IS ALSO     
20101229020449.000|20101229020451.000|CC1|VITAL TO SHRIMP FISHING AND     
20101229020451.000|20101229020451.000|CC1|ENDANGERED WILDLIFE.            
20101229020451.000|20101229020453.000|CC1|OIL SKIMMING VESSELS ARE ALSO   
20101229020453.000|20101229020454.000|CC1|BEING PUT INTO SERVICE TO CATCH 
20101229020454.000|20101229020457.000|CC1|ANY PATCHES OF OIL WHICH MAY GET
20101229020457.000|20101229020457.000|CC1|THROUGH.                        
20101229020457.000|20101229020458.000|CC1|ABOUT FIVE MILES OFFSHORE       
20101229020458.000|20101229020500.000|CC1|ANOTHER TEAM OF PRIVATE OIL     
20101229020500.000|20101229020501.000|CC1|CONTAINMENT WORKERS IS IS       
20101229020501.000|20101229020502.000|CC1|PREPARED TO INTERCEPT DRIFTING  
20101229020502.000|20101229020504.000|CC1|OIL BEFORE IT GETS TO LAND.     
20101229020504.000|20101229020505.000|CC1|THE COAST GUARD HAS ALREADY SAID
20101229020505.000|20101229020506.000|CC1|IT WILL BE IMPOSSIBLE TO GET IT 
20101229020506.000|20101229020508.000|CC1|ALL, AND THEY'RE PARTICULARLY   
20101229020508.000|20101229020510.000|CC1|CONCERNED ABOUT OIL MOVING UNDER
20101229020510.000|20101229020510.000|CC1|WATER.                          
20101229020510.000|20101229020512.000|CC1|>> PLUMES OF OIL MOVING UNDER   
20101229020512.000|20101229020513.000|CC1|WATER.                          
20101229020513.000|20101229020515.000|CC1|OIL CONTAINMENT TEAMS, SKIMMING 
20101229020515.000|20101229020516.000|CC1|VESSELS.                        
20101229020516.000|20101229020517.000|CC1|AGAIN, THESE ARE NOT BADLY      
20101229020517.000|20101229020519.000|CC1|COLORIZED REPORTS FROM THE BP   
20101229020519.000|20101229020522.000|CC1|OIL DISASTER IN THE GULF RIGHT  
20101229020522.000|20101229020523.000|CC1|NOW, THIS IS REPORTING FROM DEJA
20101229020523.000|20101229020525.000|CC1|VU LAND, FROM ESSENTIALLY THE   
20101229020525.000|20101229020525.000|CC1|SAME DISASTER IN THE GULF OF    
20101229020525.000|20101229020527.000|CC1|MEXICO BUT IN 1979.             
20101229020527.000|20101229020528.000|CC1|THE ONLY THING MISSING BACK THEN
20101229020528.000|20101229020530.000|CC1|WAS WORRIES THAT THE LOOP       
20101229020530.000|20101229020531.000|CC1|CURRENT WOULD CARRY THE OIL OUT 
20101229020531.000|20101229020532.000|CC1|OF THE GULF OF MEXICO ALL THE   
20101229020532.000|20101229020536.000|CC1|WAY TO THE COAST OF FLORIDA.    
20101229020536.000|20101229020537.000|CC1|OH, WAIT.                       
20101229020537.000|20101229020539.000|CC1|>> THERE IS NOW A DISTINCT      
20101229020539.000|20101229020541.000|CC1|POSSIBILITY THAT OIL SPILLING   
20101229020541.000|20101229020544.000|CC1|FROM THAT RUNAWAY MEXICAN WELL  
20101229020544.000|20101229020546.000|CC1|COULD SPREAD AS FAR AS THE COAST
20101229020546.000|20101229020547.000|CC1|OF FLORIDA, THAT FROM AN        
20101229020547.000|20101229020549.000|CC1|OFFICIAL FROM THE EPA.          
20101229020549.000|20101229020552.000|CC1|>> THE IXTOC DISASTER IN 1979 IN
20101229020552.000|20101229020554.000|CC1|THE GULF OF MEXICO WENT ON FOR  
20101229020554.000|20101229020555.000|CC1|WEEK, AND WEEKS TURNED INTO     
20101229020555.000|20101229020555.000|CC1|MONTHS.                         
20101229020555.000|20101229020557.000|CC1|THE REASON IT WENT ON SO LONG IS
20101229020557.000|20101229020558.000|CC1|BECAUSE ALTHOUGH OIL COMPANIES  
20101229020558.000|20101229020601.000|CC1|WERE ALLOWED TO DRILL OFFSHORE  
20101229020601.000|20101229020603.000|CC1|LIKE THAT, IT TURNS OUT THEY    
20101229020603.000|20101229020605.000|CC1|DIDN'T KNOW HOW TO STOP A LEAK  
20101229020605.000|20101229020606.000|CC1|WHEN DISASTER STRUCK.           
20101229020606.000|20101229020607.000|CC1|NOTHING THEY TRIED WORKED.      
20101229020607.000|20101229020608.000|CC1|>> IN THE GULF OF MEXICO, RAIN  
20101229020608.000|20101229020610.000|CC1|AND HEAVY SEAS ARE HAMPERING    
20101229020610.000|20101229020611.000|CC1|EFFORTS TO CAP A MEXICAN OIL    
20101229020611.000|20101229020613.000|CC1|WELL THAT HAS BEEN SPILLING     
20101229020613.000|20101229020615.000|CC1|SINCE JUNE 3, THE WORST SPILL IN
20101229020615.000|20101229020616.000|CC1|HISTORY.                        
20101229020616.000|20101229020617.000|CC1|WORKERS ARE TRYING TO PUT A     
20101229020617.000|20101229020619.000|CC1|GIANT CONE OVER THE WELL.       
20101229020619.000|20101229020620.000|CC1|DESPITE INCLEMENT WEATHER, THEY 
20101229020620.000|20101229020621.000|CC1|MAY TRY AGAIN TODAY.            
20101229020621.000|20101229020624.000|CC1|>> TRYING TO PUT A GIANT CONE   
20101229020624.000|20101229020624.000|CC1|OVER THE WELL.                  
20101229020624.000|20101229020625.000|CC1|IN 2010, THIS GIANT CONE        
20101229020625.000|20101229020628.000|CC1|STRATEGY IS WHAT WE WERE SORT OF
20101229020628.000|20101229020629.000|CC1|EUPHEMISTICALLY CALLING THE TOP 
20101229020629.000|20101229020629.000|CC1|HAT.                            
20101229020629.000|20101229020633.000|CC1|WONDER IF THEY HAD A EUPHEMISTIC
20101229020633.000|20101229020634.000|CC1|NAME FOR IT BACK IN 1979.       
20101229020634.000|20101229020636.000|CC1|>> MEXICAN OFFICIALS ARE CALLING
20101229020636.000|20101229020638.000|CC1|IT OPERATION SOMBRERO.          
20101229020638.000|20101229020639.000|CC1|WORKERS HAVE BEEN TRYING SINCE  
20101229020639.000|20101229020641.000|CC1|THE WEEKEND TO PUT A 300-TON

20101229020643.000|20101229020644.000|CC1|RUNAWAY WELL.

20101229020654.000|20101229020656.000|CC1|DAY HAVE FLOATED TO THE BAY OF  
20101229020656.000|20101229020658.000|CC1|CAMPECHE AND THE GULF OF MEXICO.
